qas.question: On what day was Alaskan Statehood finally approved by Congress?
On what day was Alaska officially named a state?
What cause did James Wickersham focus on in his early Congressional tenure?
In what year did Alaskan Statehood gain momentum following a territorial referendum?
From which areas did Alaskan supporters face political challenges?

answers.text: mostly in the U.S. Congress but also within Alaska

qas.question: On what day was Alaskan Statehood finally disapproved by Congress?
On what day was Alaska unofficially named a state?
What cause did James Wickersham focus on in his later Congressional tenure?
In what year did Alaskan Statehood lose momentum following a territorial referendum?

context: <a2_0><b7_0>Statehood for Alaska<b7_0/><a2_0/> was an important cause of James Wickersham early in his tenure as a congressional delegate. Decades later, the statehood movement gained its first real momentum following a territorial referendum in <a3_0><b8_0>1946<b8_0/><a3_0/>. The Alaska Statehood Committee and Alaska's Constitutional Convention would soon follow. Statehood supporters also found themselves fighting major battles against political foes, <a4_0>mostly in the U.S. Congress but also within Alaska<a4_0/>. Statehood was approved by Congress on <a0_0><b5_0>July 7, 1958<b5_0/><a0_0/>. Alaska was officially proclaimed a state on <a1_0><b6_0>January 3, 1959<b6_0/><a1_0/>.
